Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
This class contains the necessary attributes of the player. It contains the player's name, money, and the player's inventory. It also contains the necessary actions for each tool as well as harvesting.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(FarmerType type)
    This constructor assigns the name and initializes each attribute.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(FarmerType type)
      This constructor assigns the name and initializes each attribute.
      Parameters:
      type - the starting farmer type of the player

  • Method Details

    • updateFarmerType

      public boolean updateFarmerType(FarmerType newType)
      This method helps change the certain farmer type of the player by checking if the player has reached a certain level and has enough objectCoins to afford it.
      Parameters:
      newType - Is new type of farmer that the player wants to change to.
      Returns:
      true if the player has met the requirements for the next type

    • plant

      public boolean plant(Seed seed, Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value to determine if a crop has been successfully plants onto a tile. For a crop to be planted, the tile is plowed, doesn't already have a seed, and the player has enough coins.
      Parameters:
      seed - The seed that that the player wants to plant onto the tile.
      tile - The tile that the player is trying to plant a crop on.
      Returns:
      true if a crop has been successfully planted.

    • plow

      public boolean plow(Tools tool, Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value whether a tile has been successfully plowed For it to return a true value, the tile must not be plowed so it is not required to check if there is a crop on the tile since the tile will be already plowed. Otherwise, it will return a false value. If plowed correctly, the tile will be updated to plowed, objectCoins of the player is deducted by the cost of using the certain tool, and the player receives a certain amount of xp.
      Parameters:
      tool - The tool that the player is using
      tile - The tile that the player is trying to plow
      Returns:
      true if it was successfully plowed.

    • water

      public boolean water(Tools tool, Tile tile)
      This method returns a booleran value whether a tile has been successfully watered. The tile can only be successfully watered if the tile has a seed. Otherwise, it will return false. If watered correctly, it will update the amount of times the tile was watered, objectCoins of the player is deducted by the cost of using the certain tool, the player receives a certain amount of xp.
      Parameters:
      tool - The tool that the player is using to water the tile
      tile - The tile that the player is trying to water
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully watered.

    • fertilize

      public boolean fertilize(Tools tool, Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value whether a tile has been successfully fertilized. The tile can only be successfully fertilized if the player has enough objectCoins and the tile has no seed. If fertilized correctly, it will update the amount of times the tile was fertilized, objectCoins of the player is deducted by the cost of using the certain tool, the player receives a certain amount of xp, and the method returns a true value.
      Parameters:
      tool - The tool that is being used to fertilize the tile.
      tile - The tile that the player is trying to fertilize.
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully fertilized.

    • mine

      public boolean mine(Tools tool, Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value whether a tile has been successfully mined. The tile can only be successfully mined if the player has enough objectCoins and the tile has a rock. If mined correctly, it will update the tile to not have a rock, subtract the objectCoins of the player by the cost of using the certain tool, the player receives a certain amount of xp, and the method returns a true value.
      Parameters:
      tool - the tool that the player is using
      tile - The tile that the player is trying to mine
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully mined.

    • dig

      public boolean dig(Tools tool, Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value whether a tile has been successfully dug by having enough obejectCoins. If the tile was dug up, objectCoins of the player is deducted by the cost of using the tool, the player receives a certain amount of xp, the tile values are set to null, and the method returns a true value. Otherwise it will return a false value.
      Parameters:
      tool - the tool that the player is using
      tile - a Tile object
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully dug.

    • harvest

      public boolean harvest(Tile tile)
      This method returns a boolean value whether a tile has been successfully harvested. If the tile was successfully harvested, the method will do computations to determine the amount of coins and xp that the player will receive. The tile will then reset and the method will return a true value. Otherwise, it will return a false value.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile that is being harvested.
      Returns:
      A boolean value whether a tile has been successfully harvested.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      This method computes and returns the certain level that the player has reached.
      Returns:
      The level of the player.

    • getCoins

      public double getCoins()
      This method returns the amount of objectCoins that the player has.
      Returns:
      The objectCoins variable

    • getType

      public String getType()
      This method returns the type of farmer the player is in.(farmer, registered, distinguished, legendary)
      Returns:
      The type of farmer the player is.

    • getXp

      public double getXp()
      This method returns the amount of xp that the player has.
      Returns:
      current xp of player

    • getFeedbackString

      public String getFeedbackString()
      This method returns the feedback string that is being used to display the feedback to the player.
      Returns:
      The feedback string.
